sentences: Hello, monkey
I like the monkey.
I like the berry.
I like you.
I want the fruit.
The bird wants the red berry.
Give me that fruit.
This is a red fruit.
The bird has the yellow berry.
She loves the berry.
I have the green berry and the yellow berry.
This tastes yummy.
The apple is a red fruit.
This red fruit isn't a berry.
I like that yellow berry.
This yellow bird has a red berry.
This red bird isn't my friend.
My friend loves that green fruit.
I want this red fruit and that yellow berry.
I love big berries.
I have 2 friends on this island.
These are my friends.
I love monkeys.
Monkeys eat bananas.
This tiger loves bananas and meat.
Tigers live in the jungle.
They are hungry now.
They don't have berries.
They know that you have the fruits.
They only want your blue berries.
They don't care about the yellow berries.
They have enough red berries.
These berries are awesome.
Send them more berries.
The birds love the yummy berries.
The berries are red and green and yellow.
You have many bananas and berries.
My friend loves berries and bananas.
They like the tasty fruits.
I am looking at some berries for my friend.
The monkeys are throwing the fruits down.
The tiger is picking the berries.
The birds are flying in the sky.
My friend is sitting on the ground and eating the berries.
The bird is singing softly.
She is feeling happy.
The pretty bird and I are eating the wonderful berries.
It is raining here.
We are running to the cave fast.
We are hiding in an old cave.
I am feeling cold and wet.
We are going to another cave.
The other animals are searching for us.
They aren't finding us.
The beautiful sun is shining now.
It isn't raining now and we are coming out.
We are walking outside.
We are feeling warm and dry.
We are dancing and playing together.
The tiger is telling us funny stories.
We are excited and having fun.
Do you have a berry for my friend?
I don't like coconuts.
I want to eat some fish for breakfast.
Do you also want some fish?
Does the bear want to eat berries?
It is very cold here.
I want to drink hot coffee.
Do you have warm blankets for me?
I want cold meat and vegetables.
They are busy today.
Do they know that the berries are here?
Do you give them the berries?
Do they take the berries and run away?
Don't you like the berries?
Are we waiting for the birds to come?
Let us eat the berries together.
I don't want to eat the berries now.
I will eat them later.
The elephant said that the berries are very hard.
These will become soft later.
The elephant came here last year.
He met the monkeys in the forest.
The monkeys showed him the berries.
The elephant liked the monkeys and stayed in the jungle.
Did he play with the monkeys?
He talked to the birds.
He also fought with them.
He didn't like the monkeys.
The monkeys sometimes did the wrong things.
He taught them the right things.
The monkeys agreed with him.
They became friends recently.
The animals will go to the beach tomorrow.
They will eat their favorite berries together.
They want to have fun because they are friends now.
How are you doing?
I am doing good.
They are going to the park.
How is the day today?
Today is warm and wonderful.
What will they do in the park?
They will play together and have fun.
What is the tiger chasing?
The tiger is chasing the little monkey.
When will they stop playing?
They will stop playing soon.
Why did they stop?
They stopped because they are thirsty.
How many animals are playing?
50 animals are there.
Which animal is the most tired animal?
My favorite monkey is the most tired animal.
Why did he become tired?
He was running very fast.
Where are the birds?
The birds are flying far and high.
When will they come back?
They will come back in the evening.
What will they do?
They will listen to the stories about the monkeys.
Let us stand under the waterfall.
Many stones are under my feet.
The fishes are swimming near us.
Why are the monkeys sitting on the tree?
They are throwing the berries on the ground.
The berries are falling on his round head.
He is closing his eyes and touching the berries.
He is picking them using his hands and putting them in his mouth.
He will remember to wear a cap on his head tomorrow.
Did he keep the berries in a box?
He hid the berries under the ground.
He doesn't want to share them with his friends.
The elephant is standing below the tree.
The slow tiger couldn't catch the fast monkeys.
They were moving very fast.
The monkeys are free again.
They won the game.
Who will catch the biggest fish today?
Let us go to the nearest river and teach the bear to fish.
The water is flowing faster now.
The bear is catching the bigger fish.
My fish is the smallest fish.
Today is the hottest day.
What are the other animals doing?
The older monkeys are climbing the tree.
The younger monkeys are watching their friends.
Why is the bear pulling the shortest monkey's tail?
That monkey has the longest tail.
The braver monkeys are playing with the tiger.
Don't you see that the tallest monkeys are riding on the elephant?
The bored bird is most surprised.
The younger monkeys are getting the food from the elephant.
These are the yummiest berries.
We must make a great dinner tonight.
What can we cook?
Can you call the bear to help us?
The bear cooks the best fish.
He can make anything using fish.
Can you bring the fish?
You may clean the dirty fish.
I will cut some vegetables.
We can start cooking in the night.
Can you get me the salt and the pepper?
We must cook before the animals come.
The food is almost ready now.
The bear said that he must have the biggest piece.
Can't you hear them?
He may come here first.
We must keep some food for the other animals.
The monkeys may come later tonight.
It was the tastiest food.
We ate everything.
I felt sad because the tiger couldn't eat his favorite food.
We must cook something different tomorrow.
We can't eat the same food everyday because we want something interesting.
We will make more food next month and call them again.
Where have you been?
I want to share something important with you.
I have been searching for the elephant.
Do you know that the elephant has run away?
The bad people have taken his baby to the forest.
The young men and boys were hiding the baby.
I think that they had come here yesterday.
Someone has taken her away when she was sleeping.
She must have been really scared.
He couldn't save his baby.
He didn't want to lose his baby.
Couldn't anyone have helped him?
We need to help him.
He got a new idea later.
He thought that we must save the baby.
He said that everyone must listen to him.
Everyone must help him find the baby.
We searched and found the baby.
It was easy to find her because we had worked hard.
We have brought the little baby elephant back.
Had she eaten any food?
She had eaten nothing yesterday.
She has been eating less food today.
She has been sick and sleepy.
She couldn't eat much food.
We have been giving her extra fruits.
She is feeling strong and happy now.
